24 TEST(GeneratedImage, ConnectionFree)
25 {
26 
29 
30  double mapSize = 20.0;
31  double resolution = 0.1;
32 
33  int pixels = (int)mapSize / resolution;
34 
35  // Create an OgMap which is occupied (all zeros)
36  cv::Mat image = cv::Mat::zeros(pixels, pixels, CV_8UC1);
37 
38  // Let's check map size compared to allocation, just in case
39  ASSERT_EQ(pixels, image.rows);
40  ASSERT_EQ(pixels, image.cols);
41 
42  // Let's check the map is allocated all zeros
43  ASSERT_EQ(0, image.at<uchar>(0, 0));
44 
45  // o------> j
46  // |
47  // |
48  // v i
49  //
50 
53  ImageProcessing imageProcessing(image, true);
54 
55  cv::Point orig(pixels / 4, pixels / 2);
56  cv::Point dest(3 * pixels / 4, pixels / 2);
57 
58  // Should the image allow the origin and destination to be connected in a straight line?
59  ASSERT_FALSE(imageProcessing.checkConnectivity(orig, dest));
60 
61  //Now make OgMap which is free space
62  image.setTo(cv::Scalar(255, 255, 255));
63  imageProcessing.setImage(image);
64 
65  // Does the image now allow the origin and destination to be connected with a straight line?
66  ASSERT_TRUE(imageProcessing.checkConnectivity(orig, dest));
67 
68  // Draw a black line down the middle
69  cv::Point pt1(pixels / 2, 0);
70  cv::Point pt2(pixels / 2, pixels);
71  cv::line(image, pt1, pt2, cv::Scalar(0, 0, 0), 1);
72 
73  // Does the image now allow the origin and destination to be connected with a straight line?
74  ASSERT_FALSE(imageProcessing.checkConnectivity(orig, dest));
75 }

77 TEST(OGMapSample_1, ConnectionFree)
78 {
79  std::string path = ros::package::getPath("path_follow");
80  // Now we have the path, the images for our testing are stored in a subfolder /test/samples
81  path += "/test/samples/";
82  // The file is called smiley_og.png
83  std::string file = path + "path_test_1.png";
84 
85  cv::Mat image = cv::imread(file, 0); //The zero forces it to a grayscale image (single channel, such as OgMap)
86 
87  ASSERT_EQ(image.rows, image.cols); // Test if aquare image
88  ASSERT_EQ(image.channels(), 1); // Test if aingle channel
89 
91  ImageProcessing imageProcessing(image, true);
92 
93  //Questions? Why do we have the {} around the below statements?
94  {
95  cv::Point org(79, 100);
96  cv::Point dest(144, 102);
97 
98  ASSERT_TRUE(imageProcessing.checkConnectivity(org, dest));
99  }
100 
101  {
102  cv::Point org(79, 100);
103  cv::Point dest(50, 102);
104 
105  ASSERT_FALSE(imageProcessing.checkConnectivity(org, dest));
106  }
107 
108  {
109  cv::Point org(79, 100);
110  cv::Point dest(80, 131);
111 
112  ASSERT_FALSE(imageProcessing.checkConnectivity(org, dest));
113  }
114  {
115  cv::Point org(100, 100);
116  cv::Point dest(103, 66.5);
117 
118  ASSERT_TRUE(imageProcessing.checkConnectivity(org, dest));
119  }
120 }

132  ASSERT_EQ(image.channels(), 1); // Test if aingle channel

136

141  ASSERT_TRUE(imageProcessing.checkConnectivity(org, dest));
142  }
143

147

159

164 TEST(No_Close_Obstacle, Obstacle_Detection)
165 {
166  ObstacleDetection obtacleDetection;
167  std::string path = ros::package::getPath("path_follow");
168  // Now we have the path, the images for our testing are stored in a subfolder /test/samples
169  path += "/test/bag/";
170  // The file is called smiley_og.png
171  std::string file = path + "test_laser_reading_1.bag";
172 
174  rosbag::Bag bag;
175  bag.open(file); // BagMode is Read by default
176  sensor_msgs::LaserScan::ConstPtr laserScan;
177 
178  for (rosbag::MessageInstance const m : rosbag::View(bag))
179  {
180  laserScan = m.instantiate<sensor_msgs::LaserScan>();
181  if (laserScan != nullptr)
182  {
183  // Now we have a laserScan so we can proceed
184  break;
185  }
186  }
187 
188  bag.close();
189  ASSERT_NE(laserScan, nullptr);
190  {
191  bool free = obtacleDetection.detectObtacle(laserScan);
192  ASSERT_EQ(true, free);
193  }
194 }
195 
196 TEST(Close_Obstacle, Obstacle_Detection)
197 {
198  ObstacleDetection obtacleDetection;
199  std::string path = ros::package::getPath("path_follow");
200  // Now we have the path, the images for our testing are stored in a subfolder /test/samples
201  path += "/test/bag/";
202  // The file is called smiley_og.png
203  std::string file = path + "test_laser_reading_2.bag";
204 
206  rosbag::Bag bag;
207  bag.open(file); // BagMode is Read by default
208  sensor_msgs::LaserScan::ConstPtr laserScan;
209 
210  for (rosbag::MessageInstance const m : rosbag::View(bag))
211  {
212  laserScan = m.instantiate<sensor_msgs::LaserScan>();
213  if (laserScan != nullptr)
214  {
215  // Now we have a laserScan so we can proceed
216  break;
217  }
218  }
219 
220  bag.close();
221  ASSERT_NE(laserScan, nullptr);
222  {
223  bool detected = obtacleDetection.detectObtacle(laserScan);
224  ASSERT_EQ(false, detected);
225  }
226 }
